intro: Iochroma confertiflorum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, producing clusters of vibrant blue or purple flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Iochroma confertiflorum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
